abstract: Washington State legislators will consider bills that will provide incentives for private utilities Puget Sound Energy, PacificCorp and Avista to divest themselves of electricity obtained from coal-fired plants; conservationists express concern that measures remove too much oversight over the utilities and would not ensure that coal is replaced by cleaner energy source.
lead_paragraph: New measures could lead to the shutdown of a large coal-fired power plant in eastern Montana that provides power to a chunk of the Pacific Northwest, which would have implications for state economy.

headline.main: Bills in Washington State Seek to End Use of Coal
headline.print_headline: Bills in Washington State Seek to End Use of Coal

snippet: New measures could lead to the shutdown of a large coal-fired power plant in eastern Montana that provides power to a chunk of the Pacific Northwest, which would have implications for state economy.
